interface.name: org_lingmo_window_management
interface.description:
This interface manages application windows. It provides requests to show and hide the desktop and emits an event every time a window is created so that the client can use it to manage the window.
Only one client can bind this interface at a time.

request.name: show_desktop
request.description: Tell the compositor to show/hide the desktop.

arg.name: internal_window_uuid
arg.summary: The internal window uuiid of the window to create

event.name: show_desktop_changed

description.summary: notify the client when the show desktop mode is entered/left

event.description:
This event will be sent whenever the show desktop mode changes. E.g. when it is entered or left.
On binding the interface the current state is sent.

event.name: stacking_order_changed

description.summary: notify the client when stacking order changed

event.description: This event will be sent when stacking order changed and on bind

event.name: window_created

description.summary: notify the client that a window was mapped

event.description: This event will be sent immediately after a window is mapped.

interface.name: org_lingmo_window
interface.description:
Manages and control an application window.
Only one client can bind this interface at a time.

request.name: set_state
request.description:
Set window state. Can set multiple states at once.
Values for state argument are described by org_lingmo_window_management.state and can be used together in a bitfield. The flags bitfield describes which flags are supposed to be set, the state bitfield the value for the set flags.
The state argument is not a boolean value, but a bitfield, so it is possible to set multiple states at once. Only the states that are set in the flags bitfield will be changed.
For example:
If flags was 0x14(keep_above|maximized) and state was 0x04(maximized), the window would be maximized, but not keep above.
If flags was 0x04(maximized) and state was 0x14(keep_above|maximized), the window would be maximized but not change keep above state.

request.name: set_minimized_geometry

description.summary: set the geometry for a taskbar entry

request.description: Sets the geometry of the taskbar entry for this window. The geometry is relative to a panel in particular.

request.name: unset_minimized_geometry

description.summary: set the geometry for a taskbar entry

request.description: Remove the task geometry information for a particular panel.

request.name: request_move
request.description:
Request an interactive move for this window. The pointer will move to the center of the window and move with the pointer.
When mouse button is released, the interactive move ends.

request.name: request_resize
request.description:
Request an interactive resize for this window. The pointer will move to window right bottom corner and resize with the pointer.
When mouse button is released, the interactive resize ends.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Removes the resource bound for this org_lingmo_window.

request.name: get_icon

description.summary: Requests to get the window icon

request.description: The compositor will write the window icon into the provided file descriptor. The data is a serialized QIcon with QDataStream.

event.name: title_changed
event.description: This event will be sent as soon as the window title is changed.

event.name: app_id_changed
event.description: This event will be sent as soon as the application identifier is changed.

event.name: state_changed
event.description:
This event will be sent as soon as the window state changes.
Values for state argument are described by org_lingmo_window_management.state. It contains the whole new state of the window.

event.name: themed_icon_name_changed
event.description: This event will be sent whenever the themed icon name changes. May be null.

event.name: unmapped
event.description: This event will be sent immediately after the window is closed and its surface is unmapped.

event.name: initial_state

description.summary: All initial known state is submitted

event.description: This event will be sent immediately after all initial state been sent to the client. If the Plasma window is already unmapped, the unmapped event will be sent before the initial_state event.

event.name: parent_window
event.description: This event will be sent whenever the parent window of this org_lingmo_window changes. The passed parent is another org_lingmo_window and this org_lingmo_window is a transient window to the parent window. If the parent argument is null, this org_lingmo_window does not have a parent window.

event.name: geometry

description.summary: The geometry of this window in absolute coordinates

event.description: This event will be sent whenever the window geometry of this org_lingmo_window changes. The coordinates are in absolute coordinates of the windowing system.

event.name: icon_changed

description.summary: The icon of the window changed

event.description:
This event will be sent whenever the icon of the window changes, but there is no themed icon name. Common examples are Xwayland windows which have a pixmap based icon.
The client can request the icon using get_icon.

event.name: pid_changed

description.summary: process id of application owning the window has changed

event.description: This event will be sent when the compositor has set the process id this window belongs to. This should be set once before the initial_state is sent.

request.name: request_enter_virtual_desktop

description.summary: map window on a virtual desktop

request.description: Make the window enter a virtual desktop. A window can enter more than one virtual desktop. if the id is empty or invalid, no action will be performed.

request.name: request_enter_new_virtual_desktop

description.summary: map window on a virtual desktop

request.description: RFC: do this with an empty id to request_enter_virtual_desktop? Make the window enter a new virtual desktop. If the server consents the request, it will create a new virtual desktop and assign the window to it.

request.name: request_leave_virtual_desktop

description.summary: remove a window from a virtual desktop

request.description: Make the window exit a virtual desktop. If it exits all desktops it will be considered on all of them.

event.name: virtual_desktop_entered

description.summary: the window entered a new virtual desktop

event.description: This event will be sent when the window has entered a new virtual desktop. The window can be on more than one desktop, or none: then is considered on all of them.

event.name: virtual_desktop_left

description.summary: the window left a virtual desktop

event.description: This event will be sent when the window left a virtual desktop. If the window leaves all desktops, it can be considered on all. If the window gets manually added on all desktops, the server has to send virtual_desktop_left for every previous desktop it was in for the window to be really considered on all desktops.

event.name: application_menu

description.summary: notify the client that the current appmenu changed

event.description: This event will be sent after the application menu for the window has changed.

request.name: request_enter_activity
request.description: Make the window enter an activity. A window can enter more activity. If the id is empty or invalid, no action will be performed.

request.name: request_leave_activity

description.summary: remove a window from an activity

request.description: Make the window exit a an activity. If it exits all activities it will be considered on all of them.

event.name: activity_entered
event.description: This event will be sent when the window has entered an activity. The window can be on more than one activity, or none: then is considered on all of them.

event.name: activity_left
event.description: This event will be sent when the window left an activity. If the window leaves all activities, it will be considered on all. If the window gets manually added on all activities, the server has to send activity_left for every previous activity it was in for the window to be really considered on all activities.

request.name: send_to_output
request.description: Requests this window to be displayed in a specific output.

event.name: resource_name_changed
event.description: This event will be sent when the X11 resource name of the window has changed. This is only set for XWayland windows.

interface.name: org_lingmo_activation_feedback
interface.description: The activation manager interface provides a way to get notified when an application is about to be activated.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy the activation manager object. The activation objects introduced by this manager object will be unaffected.

event.name: activation

description.summary: notify that an app is starting

event.description: Will be issued when an app is set to be activated. It offers an instance of org_lingmo_activation that will tell us the app_id and the extent of the activation.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Notify the compositor that the org_lingmo_activation object will no longer be used.

arg.name: app_id
arg.summary: application id, as described in xdg_activation_v1

description.summary: Notifies about activation finished, either by activation or because it got invalidated
